thread.title: Ice Bears win final exhibition game - News Sentinel
thread.title_full: Ice Bears win final exhibition game - News Sentinel Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Ice Bears win final exhibition game - News Sentinel
text:
The Knoxville Ice Bears got a more encouraging look at their new group of players Sunday in a 5-4 overtime exhibition victory against the Mississippi RiverKings at the Landers Center in Southaven, Miss.
The win came less than a day after the team's first exhibition, a 5-2 loss to Fayetteville at Civic Coliseum.
Four out of Knoxville's five goals were scored by Southern Professional Hockey League rookies, including the game-winner from Jide Idowu 1:48 into overtime.
Andrew Bonazza, a rookie out of Babson College, gave Knoxville a 1-0 lead in the first period. The Ice Bears fell behind 2-1 until Zack Larue, a rookie out of UMass-Amherst, tied the game 5:06 into the second period.
Mississippi scored the final two goals of the second to take a 4-2 lead, but Larue scored again quickly into the third period and Lou Educate, who played nine games for the Ice Bears last season, forced overtime with a goal.
Rookie Garrett Sheehan was in goal for Knoxville. He made 30 saves on 34 shots.
With the exhibition slate over, Knoxville has four days off before its season opener Friday at Macon. The home opener is Saturday against Columbus.
